Gesper passed through the door of the command room and went over to the 
planning room. Belthassan was standing in front of the hologram representing 
the emplacement of the new Tripredacus base on Earth. The elder brother 
looked frustrated, his eyes closed,and didn't hear the techno-organic 
mandrill enter.

Gesper:
So what is the problem?

Belthassan:
You took your time, didn't you? (There was a grin on his face, he had said 
this jokingly.) See this? (He pointed to the high cliffs to the east of the 
base) Those rocks are a lot too high for sensor coverage from the base. It 
blocks coverage towards that area. Installing a sensor net would be 
pointless in battle; it would be destroyed far too easily. Tell me first, 
how is the shield working?

Gesper:
It should be fully operational. The only thing is I'm not sure the energy 
absorption works totally. You'll have to tell me when Melch finishes fixing 
the diversion core. (He turns to the holographic projection) As for this, I 
don't think simple reconfiguration would do the trick. How about high 
precision seismic scanners? It would work good enough for ground units 
detection...

Belthassan:
Good idea, but anything could be detected with this...

Gesper:
Then, maybe I can download a part of the matrix into the ship. This would 
provide world coverage of everything with a spark.

Belthassan:
Hmm... Yes... I could live with that. Can you do it now?

Gesper simply nodded and installed himself in front of the main computer of 
the ship and started downlaoding the program.
